newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Canberra sees labour reform by Christmas.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Canberra sees labour reform by Christmas.

text.p: Australian Industrial Relations Minister Peter Reith said on Monday he remained confident of getting the government's labour reforms through the upper house Senate by Christmas.

"I have no reason to doubt whatsoever that the legislation will be carried before Christmas and that the new system will start next year which is exactly what we said it would do," Reith told reporters.
Reith said he was encouraged that Democrats leader Cheryl Kernot's also believed the bill would pass through the Senate before Christmas.

Asked if the bill was likely to be substantially amended as a result of negotiations with the Democrats, Reith said: "What we're doing is having a constructive discussion about each and every aspect of the proposition. It would be surprising if there weren't some changes, wouldn't it?"
Reith also told a Metal Trades Industry Association of Australia conference on Monday that labour reform was critical to improvements in productivity.
"There's been a bit of a pick-up in some parts of the Australian economy, but in some sectors of the Australian economy we need to do a lot more," he said.
